title: Dallas Cowboys Complete History 1960-2003 (2003)
description:
The Dallas Cowboys: The Complete History Of America's Team 1960-2003

America's Team...

Get your seat on the fifty-yard line for a spectacular look at one of the most revered and reviled teams in NFL history.  Go inside the huddle, relive the most astonishing plays, and remember the last-second heroics that have captivated gridiron fans for more than four decades.

It's all here, awesome and authentic - from their heartbreaking losses in the 60's...through the decade of dominance in the 70's...to the arrival of Aikman, Emmitt and Irvin, and their extraordinary Super Bowl run in the 90's.  You'll also catch the 1992 NFC Championship Game, one of the greatest ever.

The History of the Dallas Cowboys is a complete look, from 1960 to the dawn of the Bill Parcells era, at the franchise that has become one of the biggest icons in pro football.  Through incredible action footage, memoirs, and interviews, this stirring DVD brings America's Team to life!

Disc 1
The Complete History of the Dallas Cowboys
Bonus Features:
1979 Redskins-Cowboys Shootout - The greatest game of the NFL's greatest rivalry
Thomas "Hollywood" Henderson - Flamboyant and talented linebacker
Cliff Harris and Charlie Waters - Best defensive backfield tandem in Cowboys history
Ed "Too Tall" Jones - The towering terror of the Dallas Doomsday Defense
Bill Bates - From special teams captain to longtime Cowboys assistant coach
Parcells' 1st Dallas Win - The stunning 2003 overtime win against his former Giants team

Disc 2
1992 NFC Championship Game
Bonus Features:
Troy Aikman - The quarterback legend, from rookie season to tearful retirement
Super Bowl XXVII Recap
The Cowboys 52-17 romp over Buffalo

Details...
Disc 1 - Video - 905M, 1:13:31, 480x360, H264, MP4 Video File
         Audio - 2 channel stereo, 44.1KHz, 128Kbps, 16 bit, AAC
Disc 2 - Video - 888M, 1:10:46, 480x360, H264, MP4 Video File
         Audio - 2 channel stereo, 44.1KHz, 128Kbps, 16 bit, AAC
Total - 2 DVD's, 1.783G, 2:24:17

How 'bout them Cowboys!
